content: Mark Thompson rushed 13 times for 134 yards and three touchdowns to lead the Houston Gamblers to a 41-16 win over the Philadelphia Stars on Saturday.

Thompson opened the scoring on a 33-yard touchdown run in the first quarter. He added a 10-yard TD in the second quarter and a 15-yard score in the third. Houston (2-2), which led 27-7 at halftime, held a 465-199 edge in yards on offense over Philadelphia (1-3).Gamblers quarterback Kenji Bahar was 15 of 21 for 230 yards. He tossed second-quarter touchdown passes to Anthony Ratliff-Williams (5 yards) and Keke Chism (54). Bahar, who did not throw an interception, injured his right ankle in the third quarter and left the game.Chism added a fumble recovery for a touchdown in the third quarter. The Stars' Case Cookus was 24 of 36 for 189 yards, one touchdown and one interception.Showboats 29, Panthers 10Quarterback Cole Kelley rushed for a pair of touchdowns and Jeff McCulloch scampered 34 yards to the end zone after a fumble recovery to lead Memphis over Michigan in Detroit.Kelley wasn't as much of a factor in the passing game, completing 15 of 26 passes for 151 yards, but his performance on the ground allowed the Showboats (1-3) to pick up their first victory. Kerrith Whyte added 54 rushing yards on 15 carries for Memphis, which sealed the victory by scoring 13 points in the fourth quarter.

Josh Love threw for 58 yards, one touchdown and one interception on 10-for-15 passing for the Panthers (2-2), while Carson Strong completed 9 of 12 passes for 75 yards and a pick. Joe Walker hauled in seven catches for 76 yards and a touchdown.--Field Level Media
